instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00292: What is 820-00292? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
threads.message: Hi, could you please share and tested, working BIOS (clean ME) for the board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? I have a problem with this iMac, it constantly turns on, starts loading system and then restarts with message "computer restarted because of an problem)". I'm not able to enter boot menu or diagnostics or safe mode. Tried other RAM or SSD - no results. Customer states, that authorised shop diagnosed HDD problem, but I really doubt..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Nnvc9szyBaJ8RoEaV_TgLktDxEF7U3Zt/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
No idea if good, test it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
threads.message:
There is a big difference in iMac behaviour with this BIOS. It chimes, lets enter to boot menu, but doesn't see internal SSD. It detects external drives and OS installers, but doesn't boot to them, keeps restarting while loading, but after restart there is no message about problem. Can I ask you to clean ME region of my BIOS? or in BIOS that you have sent me? I can do it manually, but it takes so much longer than using Medusa. 

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/18EkymeKmEhyQhs6QT89oPsV1Lo7hsyjD/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
threads.message: Sadly it doesn't work, fans are spinning but nothing other happens - no chime or image, only two leds on board turns on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00292</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean BIOS request
threads.message:
Check if still works with previous BIOS.
Also test starting in safe mode.
